creator: PromyLOPh@lavabit.com
text:
Under heady load mod_fcgid floods (one log message per request, I guess) the errorlog with useless messages like

> [notice] mod_fcgid: too many /usr/local/fcgi-bin/fcgi-php-user processes (current:20, max:20), skip the spawn request

Unfortunately log messages of level "notice" can't be suppressed when logging to a regular file. So either change the log level of this message or show it only *once* per minute/hour/whatever.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text: That message and another very similar one is now log level "info" (APLOG_INFO).  Other "notice" messages in mod_fcgid were also of a debug or informational nature and have been changed.
